content.text: "Learn once, write in more places than you thought."

- Husband, Father of 4
- Mobile App Dev ~10 years
    - Native: Android & iOS
    - Xplat: Xamarin, Unity3D, 
       React Native, Flutter
 - Ron Turley Associates (RTA)
 - GitHub: dustin-graham
Why should Flutter matter to React devs?

1. Certain advantages for native applications over React Native
2. React developers already have the knowledge, skills, and mindset 
    to be productive with Flutter on day one
3. Emerging platform with new opportunities

A portable UI Framework
  - All UI is custom drawing
  - Engine written in C++
  - Framework written in Dart
  - Compiled to native instructions
Single codebase
Inspired by React

Mobile cross-platform framework
  - Utilizes native UI Frameworks for drawing
  - Framework written in JavaScript
  - Communicates with native via bridge
Single codebase
Based on React

A nice blend of lots of good things
    - Strongly typed but with powerful dynamic features
    - Object oriented but with nice functional features
    - Single threaded but with an easy Isolates API
    - Futures + Async/Await + Streams
    - Feature-rich standard library
    - Familiar and comfortable to anyone who's written Java, C#, or JavaScript

High-performance garbage collector
    - Tight integration with the Flutter framework

Dual Compilation Modes: JIT & AOT
A Quick Tour of Dart - Type Safety
Dart is type safe with both static and  runtime checks. Includes type inference
A Quick Tour of Dart - booleans
Only boolean value 'true' is treated as true
A Quick Tour of Dart - functions
A Quick Tour of Dart - asynchronous
A Quick Tour of Dart - async/await

Complete control over UI rendering
    - Optimizations
    - No-compromise API design
    - Improved test coverage
    - Consistency

 Holistic tooling
    - Dart Language, build system, debug server & package manager
    - Flutter Framework & IDE plugins
    - Material Design integration

 Quick dev iteration speed and simplicity & great runtime Performance

Complete responsibility over UI rendering

Far less ubiquitous tech stack

Multi-platform, not cross-platform
    - Android
    - iOS
    - Web: Project Hummingbird
    - Desktop: MacOS, Windows, Linux
